Checkpoint.description: Represents a saved game state for CyberNation.

userId.description: Reference to the User who created this checkpoint. (Relationship: User 1:N Checkpoint)

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicating when the checkpoint was created.

publicApproval.description: The value of the publicApproval resource at the time of the checkpoint

treasury.description: The value of the treasury resource at the time of the checkpoint

narrativeCardId.description: Identifier of the current card shown to the user

eventIds.description: References to Events active on save. (Relationship: Checkpoint 1:N Event)

leaderboardName.description: Name of the leaderboard (e.g., 'Highest Treasury', 'Longest Survival').

description.description: Short description of the leaderboard's criteria.

LeaderboardEntry.title: LeaderboardEntry
LeaderboardEntry.description: Represents a single entry on a leaderboard.

id.description: Unique identifier for the leaderboard entry.

leaderboardId.description: Reference to the Leaderboard this entry belongs to. (Relationship: Leaderboard 1:N LeaderboardEntry)

userId.description: Reference to the User who achieved this score. (Relationship: User 1:N LeaderboardEntry)

score.description: The score achieved by the user on this leaderboard.

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicating when the score was achieved.

firestore.reasoning:
To support checkpoints and leaderboards in CyberNation, while adhering to Authorization Independence and QAPs, the Firestore structure is designed as follows:

*   **Checkpoints:** Stored under `/users/{userId}/checkpoints/{checkpointId}`. This path-based ownership ensures that only the owning user can access their checkpoints. The `userId` is included within the checkpoint document itself (denormalized), enabling rules to validate ownership without needing to `get()` the parent user document.
*   **Leaderboards:** Leaderboards are stored in the `/leaderboards/{leaderboardId}` collection. This allows for global management of leaderboards.
*   **Leaderboard Entries:**  Each entry is stored in `/leaderboards/{leaderboardId}/entries/{entryId}`.  Each `LeaderboardEntry` includes the `userId`, enabling secure listing and filtering of entries by user.  Since listing leaderboard entries must be public, no denormalization is needed.  The structure facilitates queries for top scores within a specific leaderboard without requiring complex rules.

This design achieves Authorization Independence by denormalizing the `userId` into the `Checkpoint` and `LeaderboardEntry` documents, a key security practice that avoids the need for `get()` calls to parent documents in security rules. It supports QAPs by segregating user-owned data (checkpoints) from global data (leaderboards) and using path-based ownership for checkpoints.
